title: HTML Forms: Basic Inputs
description: Learn to create forms with various input types

lessons.title: Form Structure
lessons.description:
Every form needs a <form> wrapper. Inside, use <label> to describe inputs and <input> for user data entry.

The for attribute on labels should match the id on inputs for accessibility.
lessons.task:
Create a form with:
1. A <label> with the text 'Name:' and for="name" attribute
2. A text <input> with id="name" and name="name" attributes
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui; padding: 20px; } form { max-width: 300px; } label { display: block; margin-bottom: 5px; font-weight: 500; } input { width: 100%; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 4px; box-sizing: border-box; }

validations.message: Add a 'for' attribute to your label
Add an 'id' attribute to your input

lessons.title: Input Types
lessons.description:
Different input types provide appropriate keyboards and validation:

type="text" - General text
type="email" - Email with @ validation
type="password" - Hidden characters
type="number" - Numeric keyboard
type="tel" - Phone keyboard
lessons.task:
Create a login form with two fields:
1. An email field: <label for="email">Email:</label> and <input type="email" id="email">
2. A password field: <label for="password">Password:</label> and <input type="password" id="password">
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui; padding: 20px; } form { max-width: 300px; } label { display: block; margin-top: 15px; margin-bottom: 5px; } label:first-child { margin-top: 0; } input { width: 100%; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 4px; box-sizing: border-box; }
lessons.solution:
<form>
  <label for="email">Email:</label>
  <input type="email" id="email" name="email">
  
  <label for="password">Password:</label>
  <input type="password" id="password" name="password">
</form>

lessons.title: Submit Button
lessons.description:
Forms need a way to submit data. Use:

<button type="submit"> - Preferred, flexible content
<input type="submit"> - Simple text-only button

The button text should be action-oriented (e.g., 'Sign In', 'Register', 'Send').
lessons.task: Add a submit button to the form with the text 'Sign In'.
lessons.previewBaseCSS: body { font-family: system-ui; padding: 20px; } form { max-width: 300px; } label { display: block; margin-top: 15px; margin-bottom: 5px; } label:first-child { margin-top: 0; } input { width: 100%; padding: 8px; border: 1px solid #ccc; border-radius: 4px; box-sizing: border-box; } button { width: 100%; margin-top: 20px; padding: 10px; background: #1976d2; color: white; border: none; border-radius: 4px; cursor: pointer; font-size: 16px; } button:hover { background: #1565c0; }
lessons.initialCode:
<form>
  <label for="email">Email:</label>
  <input type="email" id="email">
  
  <label for="password">Password:</label>
  <input type="password" id="password">
  
  <!-- Add submit button -->
</form>
lessons.solution:
<form>
  <label for="email">Email:</label>
  <input type="email" id="email">
  
  <label for="password">Password:</label>
  <input type="password" id="password">
  
  <button type="submit">Sign In</button>
</form>

validations.message: Add a submit button to your form
